description:
LVL is a premium financial services company that offers cryptocurrency trading and a checking account in one easy-to-use mobile app. LVL is the only platform in North America to offer free Bitcoin trading - no trading fees and no hidden spreads. LVL also offers neobank features such as direct deposit, wires, mobile check deposits, and a Mastercard debit card.

LVL has received $4.5M in funding from top investors including TenOneTen, Morgan Creek Digital, Capital Factory, and others.

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for LVL and our customers. We believe that engineers should accelerate the business through technology, and collaborate across multiple teams to accomplish that. They will work cross-functionally across the company, interfacing directly with vendors, triaging with support, and managing compliance risk. The engineering team is autonomous, eager to learn, teach and constantly improve how things work.

The Software Engineer will report to the CEO and will:

  • Publish OTA updates to LVL’s React Native app weekly, sometimes daily
  • Triage technical issues with support, develop solutions, plan sprints, and follow through to completion
  • Learn new technologies and seamlessly integrate them into LVL’s tech stack
  • Improve scalability and reliability by implementing best practices around containerization, continuous integration, load balancing
  • Build and maintain asynchronous task queues and microservices
  • Manage database migrations in production environments
  • Design APIs and integrate with external APIs
  • Build internal tools for day-to-day operations, marketing data and analytics, and site reliability. Optimized for automation.
  • Work with the CEO to architect new systems

Desired skills:

  • Python, Django
  • Javascript, React, React Native, Redux
  • AWS (EC2, RDS, Cloudwatch, Route53, S3, ELB, Lambda)
  • Nginx
  • Redis
  • PostgresSQL
  • Celery
  • Expo
  • Docker/Kubernetes/Terraform
  • Jenkins

Desired experience and education:

  • 1+ years as a software engineer
  • Experience with startups is a plus

The ideal candidate will be:

  • Flexible and responsive to the changes of a fast-paced and fast-growing company
  • Highly organized
  • Able to demonstrate a high degree of attention to detail
  • Passionate about finance, cryptocurrency, and technology
  • Proactive and always willing to learn new things
  • Looking for an opportunity to grow with the company

Equal Opportunity Employer LVL celebrates diversity and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Each applicant and employee is considered on individual merit, without discrimination as to race, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, or veteran status.

Job type: Full-time Salary

Benefits:

  • Equity
  • Health/ Dental/ Vision Insurance
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Bank Holidays off
  • Company-wide Remote Work policy with an included home office stipend.

Location: Austin, TX
Schedule: 10am to 6pm CT. Some weekend and after hours work is required.
Company Website: https://lvl.co

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Intern/Associate Engineer — Guidance, Navigation, and Control (Winter/Spring 2022)
description:
Astranis is connecting the four billion people in the world who do not currently have access to the internet. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost spacecraft to bring the world online.

We are well-funded by some of the best investors in the business and have raised over $350 million to date. We are have a world-class team that is passionate about building amazing technology. And we have a fun and collaborative work environment where you will learn a lot and make a huge impact no matter where you are in your career. Just check out our Glassdoor reviews to see what our team has to say about working at Astranis.

Our team is growing fast. Apply to be a part of our mission to connect the world!

Role:

  • Work with the Guidance, Navigation, and Control team to design, build, and test satellite hardware and software

Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S. in a technical discipline (e.g. engineering, CS, physics) with a focus on control systems, orbital mechanics, or spacecraft propulsion
  • Familiarity with classical control theory
  • Experience with python or C/C++
  • Demonstrated ability to personally design, build, and test hardware and/or software from scratch
  • US Citizenship or Green Card

Bonus:

  • Familiarity with spacecraft design
  • Experience with low thrust trajectories

Availabilities for Winter/Spring 2022

U.S. Citizenship, Lawful Permanent Residency, or Refugee/Asylee Status Required
(To comply with U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the United States, or other protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3))

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role:

  • Design test equipment to validate designs across a wide range of stressed conditions
  • Bringup and debug designs in the lab
  • Write code to help evaluate performance and automate testing of satellite hardware
  • Coordinate assembly, integration and environmental test efforts

Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. in electrical or computer engineering (or equivalent technical degree)

(To comply with U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the United States, or other protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3))

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Our mission is to bring blockchain to a billion people. The Alchemy Platform is a world class developer platform designed to make building on the blockchain easy. We've built leading infrastructure in the space, powering over $30 billion in transactions for tens of millions of users in 99% of countries worldwide.

The Alchemy team draws from decades of deep expertise in massively scalable infrastructure, AI, and blockchain from leadership roles at leading companies and universities like Google, Microsoft, Facebook, Stanford, and MIT.

Alchemy recently raised a Series B led by Coatue and Addition, having previously raised from Stanford University, Coinbase, the Chairman of Google, Charles Schwab, and the founders and executives of leading organizations.

Alchemy powers the top blockchain companies globally and has been featured in TechCrunch, Forbes, Bloomberg, and elsewhere.

The Role

As a summer intern, you’ll work directly with our world class engineering team to push forward your own project from end to end. There is a lot to do and a lot to learn, so be prepared to dive in headfirst for 12-14 weeks as you immerse yourself in the world of blockchain. We’re growing fast and moving even faster so we can’t say exactly what you’ll be working on next summer, but potential projects range from developing new APIs and features to creating internal tooling. So join us on our mission to bring blockchain to a billion people.

Responsibilities

  • Apply knowledge from course work and learnings from previous experiences to real world problems
  • Collaborate with the engineering team and work closely with your mentor to deliver on a well-scoped project
  • Move quickly and learn about the blockchain space

What We're Looking For

  • Pursuing a Bachelors (Juniors/Seniors only), Masters, or PhD with a focus on subjects related to software development, computer science and/or mathematics
  • Experience coding in at least two general purpose programming language, preferably Java, Typescript or Python
  • Interest in the blockchain space, demonstrated with course work, extracurriculars, open source contributions and/or work experience
  • At least one previous Software Engineering internship with proven ability to execute and exposure to real-world systems
  • Strong verbal and written English communication skills
  • Exposure to web application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, and networking is a plus
  • Ability to work in San Francisco or New York

💘 Our Mission

Shinkei Systems builds robotics that multiply the shelf-life of wild caught fish.

With only 1 in every 3 fish caught making it to a plate, the fishing industry has numerous waste problems to solve from both tails of the operational chain that could save billions.

Spun out from researchers at Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science, Shinkei uses computer vision and robotics to redefine how we treat the animals we catch and eat. We are experienced moonshot prototypers and have exhibited design work internationally at top venues. Our board has professors from the top robotics schools in the world and experienced founders in the area.

We are looking for energetic folks to join our team who are excited to create technology that transforms the world at scale.

👀 The Opportunity

Ever wonder why we pay a premium for sushi?

Why confined, farmed fish are the standard in supermarkets?

How large legacy industries operationally tick?

Shinkei is looking for mechanical engineers for a paid opportunity over the summer to work on transforming society’s relationship with an animal that feeds billions of mouths annually. We’re on the lookout for people who love to get their hands dirty building working prototypes for moonshot ideas and who can take responsibility meeting deadlines over extended project timelines.

You won't be limited to clinking metal — we believe engineers should be involved in company strategy, product direction, and anything else you might be interested in.

What You Get To Do:

  • Design real robotics solutions to solve major humanitarian concerns
  • Utilize mechanical engineering tools by building a product end-to-end
  • Work autonomously in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment from either New York or Philadelphia
  • Unrestricted access to a makerspace
  • Talk to real customers for user research on design
  • Set the foundation for our engineering culture
  • Travel to Maryland to try out traditional techniques aboard industrial boats
  • Have a hand in transforming our relationship with our food

What You Need:

  • An innovative mind with a practical bend and an interest in changing the way we consume our food
  • Pursuing bachelors or masters in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, similar field or sufficient previous experience
  • Background (portfolio, side projects, coursework) in physical prototyping, gantry design and misc. mechanical engineering projects
  • Basic abilities with mechanical design tools (SolidWorks, FEA, drawings and documentation)
  • Capable of researching, designing and testing using rapid prototyping techniques
  • Experience with lab testing and fabrication equipment
  • Familiarity with common manufacturing processes a plus
  • Exposure and interest to robotics or embedded systems a strong plus

The position

Dusty is hiring engineering interns for 2022! Spend your co-op semester or summer break with us. Learn about the inner workings of a fast-growing hardware startup with a breakout product in the heart of Silicon Valley. Enjoy the satisfaction of writing code that ends up in customers’ hands. Spend time at construction sites where our robot is printing layouts to evaluate your contributions in action.

Our engineering team designs and builds our mobile printing robot, the software that runs the robot, the user interfaces that help workers operate the robot, and customer-facing portals that are driving fundamental change in the process of constructing buildings. As an intern, you could work on any area of our product, depending on your background:

  • Software Engineering (C++, Python, iOS, React / full-stack web development)
  • Robotics
  • Control Systems
  • Data Science
  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering
  • Mechatronics
  • UX design

If you span more than one of these areas, even better! We love generalists who are always ready to spring from one set of skills to another.

We like to give interns projects that combine getting a specific piece of work done with an open question to explore for further refinement. For example, you might integrate a new sensor on the robot, then collect data to evaluate its performance. Or, you might implement a specific feature in the operator interface, then head out to a construction site to see how useful it is to operators. You’ll experience this fundamental cycle of product development for yourself.

Working at Dusty

We are a culture of do-ers who respect each others’ strengths, and work together to accomplish the impossible. We value open-mindedness, technical depth, passion for what we’re building, an itch to build something with your own two hands. We celebrate people who create their own narratives rather than living someone else’s.

We also provide mentorship in all areas of engineering to help you do your best work. In addition to day-to-day guidance from experienced engineers, we host weekly discussions on engineering topics. We reimburse attendance fees for technology conferences on robotics and other fields. And we offer support in accessing whatever resources you find helpful.

Spending your internship in Silicon Valley also offers tremendous opportunities to learn from the concentration of innovative people who work and live here! You’ll find conferences, meetups, presentations and informal get-togethers related to pretty much any area of technology or the tech industry that interests you. Dusty is located in the heart of it all.

What You'll Do:

As an intern with Dusty Robotics, and part of the Robot Pit Crew, you will be focused on Robot Readiness, prepping the robots for their jobs in the field after they return from a hard day's work. You will perform a number of tasks to ensure that robots are ready to go out into the field, which will vary from basic QA responsibilities to troubleshooting and solving logistics issues in getting our robots readied to go to customers. You will be an integral part of keeping our team organized, both digitally and physically, including organizing field supplies for easy access as well as keeping track of which robot is where.

Some of the focus backgrounds that would be key to our mission are in mechanical, electromechanical, mechatronics or robotics. Primary focus will be maintenance, test, troubleshooting, packing, and overall readiness of our field robots. You may even get to spend some time in the field with the robots!

Who You Are:

  • Proficient computer skills (AutoCAD experience helpful)
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • High attention to detail and good organizational skills
  • Proven problem solver
  • Solid math skills (arithmetic and geometry)
  • Able to lift and carry 50-lb equipment on uneven ground
  • Driver's license with clean driving record

Where You'll Work:

Our office is located in an office building in Mountain View, CA. We’re about two miles from the Caltrain station and a variety of restaurants along Castro Street.

This role is a part-time, temporary 20hr/week role (afternoons/evenings on weekdays). You will be working primarily in our Mountain View office, on a schedule that you and your manager mutually agree upon. You must have authorization to work in the US. No relocation assistance is provided. Preference is given to candidates who are local to the Bay Area.

Please Note:
Because we are not doing in-office interviews and all of our positions are currently remote, we have a new interview process on Google Forms where you can choose a position that you are interested in applying for and record a quick 2-3 minute video on your experience and why you would be a good fit for the position. Don't spend too much time on it, it should be quick and easy just to give us an idea of your background in Computer Science and why you would be a good fit. You can find more information about our internships at https://objectsecurity.com/internships/ and the different internship positions available.

*The link to Part 1 of the Google Form application can be found at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf7WpHoW3P1j0TGSlN0q11Xy0pCAOEuR9lXiiBNCvyy1B3SwQ/viewform . Please fill out the form to be considered for the position.

Our Company:
ObjectSecurity is a small company in downtown San Diego (we work out of a coworking space but are currently virtual). We have traditionally focused on cybersecurity but have branched out into data analytics and AI in recent years. Our award-winning, patented security product is OpenPMF, which uses cool models and algorithms to make it easier to author and maintain fine-grained, dynamic access control policies.
We are doing exciting other product developments, including a supply chain risks analysis product which takes an SAP data dump and turns it into a graph DB, and then runs analytics over it to identify risks. Another cool project is an "AI hacker" development, which uses AI to simulate a hacker.

Reverse Engineering Position:
We are looking for an intern with experience working on dynamically analyzing binaries using various tools. We currently have a contract with the Navy to analyze binaries on embedded systems. In part 2 of the application, please list tools that you have used in the past and your prior work.
We are looking for interns for both during the semester and during the summer. We are flexible with start and end dates of the internship and how many hours interns work per week.

Qualifications:
1) Available 8-16 hours per week virtually
2) Prior experience with reverse engineering, using various tools to analyze binaries, and/or extracting firmware off of a device either with an internship/job, from classes, a prior internship or from a research project.

Learning Objectives:
By working directly on software engineering projects hands-on doing front-end and back-end or working on embedded systems, hardware and/or microelectronics, interns will gain valuable experience in the software engineering field and improve upon their computer science skills as evidenced through their weekly projects.

Expectations:
1) Weekdays and hours worked are flexible based on the student's schedule but should be communicated to supervisor at the beginning of each week.
2) We will communicate with the intern virtually via email, Slack and Zoom. A supervisor will meet with the intern at the start of the day to go over the day's tasks and
3) Materials will be provided to interns at the beginning of the day. All interns are expected to push their code at the end of each work day to GitHub
4) If interns are stuck or run into an issue with their code, they are encouraged to reach out to their supervisor, since someone will almost always be available to help.

All of our positions are currently virtual.

Because we are not doing in-office interviews and all of our positions are currently remote, we have a new interview process on Google Forms where you can choose a position that you are interested in applying for and record a quick 2-3 minute video on your experience and why you would be a good fit for the position. Don't spend too much time on it, it should be quick and easy just to give us an idea of your background in Computer Science and why you would be a good fit. position: Mobile Full Stack & Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:
5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
React Javascript Framework (Must and Primary)
Open Source Backend Familiarity (Python Preferred)
Database Concepts (SQL)
React-Native (Mobile) a Plus
Automated Test Frameworks a Plus
React Web Frontend Development
React-native Web Development
Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
Node.js Experience a Plus
Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

We're looking for 2022 Summer Software Engineering Interns who will help us accomplish our mission to improve lives by learning from the experience of every cancer patient. Here's what you need to know about the internship role, our engineering team and why Flatiron Health is the right next step in building your career.

What You'll Do

  • Spend 12 weeks embedded in a fast-paced scrum team
  • Design, plan, and build a project under the guidance of an experienced engineering mentor
  • Whiteboard ideas, write code, work with stakeholders, and present your work
  • Learn more about cancer and the day-to-day intricacies of oncology than you can possibly imagine

We have openings for engineering interns across all our different product lines and technology stacks. We welcome engineering students with a genuine passion about software engineering, whether that be in the interest in working with data or building new product features, focusing on the backend or exploring more fullstack roles - We have something for you!

Who You Are

You are graduating between December 2022 and June 2023 with a BS or MS in computer science or a related field. You're excited by the prospect of rolling up your sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day. You’re a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who seeks and gives candid feedback, and values the chance to make an important impact.

  • You write clean, well-structured code
  • You have experience working in a fast-paced company
  • You are enthusiastic about working on a multi-disciplinary team
  • You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology

If this sounds like you, you'll fit right in at Flatiron.

Extra Credit

  • Contribute to an open source project
  • Fluent in Python
  • Have used Pandas, R, or another data analytics tool on a messy, real-world data set
  • Have developed apps using modern frontend frameworks like AngularJS / Ember.js
  • Have experience with SQL or another query language
  • Have deep empathy for data and a strong understanding of statistics
  • Understand experimental design, and can build for collection, measurement and interpretation of results

Why You Should Join Our Team

A career at Flatiron is a chance to work with everyone involved in the future of cancer care and research—all under one roof. Researchers, data scientists, designers, clinicians, technologists and many more all work together to improve cancer care and accelerate research.

You'll also find a culture of continuous learning, broad and inclusive employee support offerings, and a commitment to supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between. We offer:

  • Onboarding curriculum which includes presentation skills, meeting mastery, coding languages and more
  • Career coaching opportunities
  • Hackathons for all employees (not just our engineers!)
  • Housing support to help cover the cost of living in NY
  • Lunch with the Founders, social events and Team outings

Flatiron Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

description:
Who are we?

Ribbon is a first of its kind real estate technology company transforming the real estate transaction by delivering certainty, transparency and joy to the home buying process. Consumers and realtors deserve a better experience, and we have designed an open platform that welcomes everyone in the ecosystem to participate.

Our mission is to make home ownership achievable. We live out our mission every day through our core values:

Set New Standards. Our mission requires a new way forward. We start from first-principles to be different, creative and bold. Big or small, we create new norms.

Build Together. We are one team, one mission, creating vibrant communities of belonging. We unite in our passion and collaborate with optimism, integrity and trust. * *

Learn, Teach, Grow. In service of delivering a world class experience, we actively learn from our community, educate others, and celebrate the victories and struggles that come along the way.

Your Team:

We believe that software can be a driving force in making home ownership achievable, and we're looking to build a team of passionate and talented engineers to make that dream possible for more families.

At Ribbon we place a strong emphasis on start-to-finish ownership, collaboration, and inclusivity.

How you'll help make homeownership achievable:

  • You’ll design code, and test the web frontend & backend for Ribbon’s website. You’ll bring your expertise to the table to provide the best user experience to our users, partners, and customers
  • You’ll collaborate with designers, product managers, and cross-functional teams to build products that modernize the home buying process and make it fair for all
  • Implementing features with a modern set of web development tools in a highly modular codebase
  • Being an advocate of engineering practices and initiatives that keep code-quality and team velocity high

What we're looking for:

  • You are pursuing or have recently completed studies, hackathons, or bootcamps in STEM or related technical fields
  • Comfort using at least one programming language such as Javascript, Ruby, or Python
  • You have had exposure to coursework or projects on subjects like database systems, web development frameworks
  • Interest in building partnerships and working through challenges with your colleagues & excitement for code review
  • Interest and passion for Ribbon’s mission

Our interview process consists of a phone interview with the hiring manager, and a light coding challenge with two members of the team.

What we offer:

  • Market-leading compensation
  • Housing/Travel Stipend
  • Weekly Lunch & Learns with cross-functional teammates
  • Weekly meetings with manager and consistent development and goal-setting opportunities
  • Mixers & social events!
  • Opportunities for career pathing and shadowing

Even if you don’t meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply! If you’d be excited to show up for work each day, we’d be excited to have you on our team.

Here at Ribbon we’re not scared of differences. It’s how we break new ground. As we scale and we help families from every walk of life, the team we build must be reflective of the diversity that we serve. Together, we’ve built and will continue to grow, a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone has a seat at the table and the space to be their most authentic self. Ribbon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we support, celebrate, and cherish all the things that make our teammates who they are.

About the Role ✨

We are looking for an intern to join our unique internship program. You will be directly integrated into one of our squads and start building products and experiences that delight our customers. What we're looking for 👀

  • Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling such as React
  • Experience with architectural patterns of complex web applications (e.g., well-designed APIs)
  • Experience with SQL or NoSQL databases
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Pursuing a BS/MS/PhD in a Computer Science or related fields. On a typical day you might ☀️
  • Build and deliver high impact initiatives that instantly increases value and delights customers
  • Work with a Squad to research, design, code, dogfood and ship roadmap features iteratively
  • Collaborate tightly with Product and Design team to ensure a high standard for aesthetic is maintained Projects you'll be working on 👷‍♀️

Projects you work on might be similar to those each of us have taken on in the past

  • Build the next generation of analytics and customer management for restaurants. Thousands of restaurants are going to run their businesses and manage their customers with the tools you build. You will be the reason they change their menus, the way they collect feedback from their customers, and the brain behind their staffing decisions.
  • Social commerce represents one of the largest untapped opportunities in the US. It brings incremental orders to restaurants and allows them to operate more efficiently. You will own two of our social commerce pillars; party mode, which lets users engage their friends in their orders for additional discounts, and following, which lets users personally interact with their favorite restaurants. They are the essence of Snackpass’s incredible consumer experience, and represent its most ambitious bets.

About the role:

Truly autonomous drones are a new product category that demands a new kind of mobile experience. Forget complex joysticks and awkward tilt-controls: we are crafting completely novel interactions that leverage Skydio’s onboard intelligence to empower a much broader, more diverse audience of drone users.

An ideal intern candidate is a junior, senior, or MS-level college student with practical project and/or industry experience developing mobile applications on iOS or Android (or both!).

How you’ll make an impact:

  • Design, prototype, and refine advanced drone interfaces, and then polish a consistent mobile experience for release to the world.
  • Contribute to the development of user interfaces for the world’s most advanced autonomous flying camera.
  • Combine your knowledge of iOS and/or Android ecosystems with our Drone Intelligence API to help create a new gold standard for what a drone app should be.
  • Improve user experiences by incorporating augmented reality, in-app content creation, and sharing capabilities.
  • Iterate on designs based on user feedback, internal testing, and your own experiences piloting Skydio 2.

What makes you a good fit:

  • You have a passion for meticulously crafted interfaces that strike the correct balance between ease-of-use, elegance, and power.
  • Comfortability working in the iOS or Android ecosystem. For iOS we primarily use Swift 5, and leverage Apple’s best practices for UI development. For Android, we use (Java, Android Studio, Gradle, adb, Linux).
  • Ability to create tools and automate your workflows using Python scripts
  • You appreciate the value of code-review and other collaborative development practices.
  • Bonus points: You’ve shipped code to the App Store or Google Play store and have experienced the joys (and frustrations) of getting feedback from real users.

About the role:

By combining best-in-class autonomy and cloud-connected real-time visibility, drones will become critical and ubiquitous infrastructure that can be deployed and monitored in real-time to solve a variety of problems faster, cheaper, and safer than ever before. As a full-stack intern, you will work on important and exciting projects related to building out cloud features and infrastructure required to turn this vision into a reality.

An ideal intern candidate is a junior, senior, or MS-level college student with practical project and/or internship experience developing complex web applications or backend data systems.

How you’ll make an impact:

  • Leverage your past experiences, best practices, and open-ended problem solving skills to help make the world more productive, creative, and safe with autonomous drones.

Project Examples:

  • Build out customer-facing product features to enhance existing capabilities and/or enable new use cases on the Skydio Platform
  • Develop web front-ends, APIs, and drone and server-side applications for fleet management, photo and video asset management, 3D reconstruction, and more
  • Develop secure, efficient, observable, scalable, and robust software for dealing with real-time data and video from fleets of Skydio drones

What makes you a good fit:

  • Solid software engineering foundation and a commitment to writing clean, well-architected code
  • You are a junior, senior, or MS-level student with meaningful project and/or internship experience developing complex web applications or backend data systems.
  • Bonus points for experience shipping products or features within a collaborative engineering team environment.
  • Proficiency with Python and/or Javascript/Typescript
  • Familiarity with REST-ful APIs, Linux operating system configuration, build tools, relational databases (Postgres, MySQL) and caching systems (Redis, Memcached)
  • Understanding of cloud service offerings (AWS, GCP), deployment techniques, and configuration management
  • Bonus points for familiarity with robotics software development concepts

About the role:

Reliable embedded firmware acts as the brain stem of our autonomous drones and accessory products -- bridging the gap between the algorithms and the sensors/mechanical hardware. As an Embedded Software Engineering Intern, you will have the opportunity to help define and develop functionality for internal teams and/or current & future products in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.

An ideal intern candidate is a junior, senior, or MS-level college student with industry experience developing device-level embedded software or firmware.

About the team:

  • Our team is responsible for large portions of the software engineering stack, working on a wide variety of subsystems. We write bare metal and RTOS microcontroller code (generally STM32 product line), integrate and write code for embedded linux and android platforms (Qualcomm and Nvidia SOCs), maintain the associated linux kernels, and help design and bring up all new electronics.
  • We work closely with both the hardware team and the rest of the software organization, creating the foundation for the rest of the Skydio software team to build upon.

How you'll make an impact:

  • Develop and implement the embedded software that runs on the drone and our growing accessory product lines e.g. Skydio Dock
  • Characterize, integrate, and validate key subsystems (e.g. cameras, radios, flight controllers)
  • Bring up and debug new hardware
  • Write interfaces and drivers for sensors, cameras, and other devices

What makes you a good fit:

  • Practical experience writing firmware/embedded code for a physical device
  • Proficiency with C++ within the context of embedded systems
  • Proficiency with Python for testing, experimentation, and tools development
  • Ability to write clean code with appropriate abstraction boundaries
  • Ability to read schematics and use standard debugging equipment: oscilloscope, logic analyzer, multimeter
  • Ownership in digging into complex problems
  • Bonus points for embedded linux userspace and kernel development
  • Bonus points for knowledge of debugging systems at ARM assembly code level

Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world.

Cockroach Labs is the creator of CockroachDB, the most highly evolved cloud-native, distributed SQL database on the planet that scales fast, survives anything, and thrives anywhere. We created CockroachDB to unshackle teams from the constraints of their database. Join us on our mission to enable every developer to build world-changing applications!

The Role

  • During your internship you will conduct research in the context of one of the most advanced, production-quality, wide-area distributed relational databases, with a modern open-source code base.
  • You will invent, prototype and integrate new ideas and technologies that will help define the future of our products and at the same time advance state-of-the-art, ideally resulting in top-tier publications. You will work closely with an engineering / research mentor and other members of the team to achieve these goals.
  • Areas of research include, but are not limited to, storage and LSM technologies, query optimization, distributed systems topics (transaction management, concurrency, distribution and replication, allocation), testing, multi-region, SQL execution, serverless technologies, and cloud infrastructure

The Expectations

  • You will become an integrated member of our engineering team. You will work on a starter project that allows you to gain confidence in navigating the code base and gain familiarity with our engineering environment, our technology and our company.
  • You will work closely with your mentor and team on a project that aligns with your interests and the product roadmap. You will design, prototype, run experiments and analyze data to demonstrate advantages and gain valuable insights on tradeoffs and challenges. You will present your results, and, time permitting, work with your mentor to make the results broadly available to the open source and/or academic community.

You

  • You are enrolled in a Ph.D program related to databases, distributed systems, serverless or other cloud related technologies, graduating between December 2022 and May 2025.
  • You have had exposure to coursework on subjects like distributed systems, concurrency control, data replication, file systems, or SQL processing.
  • You love building relationships with your colleagues. You enjoy partnering with your teammates on challenging problems.
  • You are genuinely interested in Cockroach Labs' mission and are excited to use CockroachDB in your projects!
  • Bonus: you have past experience working on production-level or open source code.

Cockroach Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you need additional accommodations to feel comfortable during your interview process, please email us at accessibility@cockroachlabs.com.

Our interview process consists largely of programming in a real environment, and we'll be evaluating you on the skills listed above.

Why join us

Brex is reimagining financial systems so every growing company can realize their full potential. As the financial OS, we’re building software and services in one place—disrupting long-entrenched institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our customers.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for Brex and our customers. We believe that engineers should accelerate the business through technology, and collaborate across multiple teams to accomplish that.

Teams are autonomous, value inclusivity, eager to learn, teach and constantly improve how things work. The software we build today is the foundation for dozens of Brex systems in the future, so engineers have a strong sense of ownership and accountability and take pride in their craft.

What you’ll do

We’re looking for folks with an interest in building products, services and infrastructure, comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces. In partnership with your mentor and team, you’ll be building solutions that will drive direct business impact and shape our long-term technical vision with a high-quality bar. You'll have the opportunity to learn and push the frontier of providing the best financial software experience to help companies grow. You’ll be encouraged to be metric and data-driven and to think creatively to help Brex scale and get prepared for the new markets we are about to enter.

  • Design and build solutions across multiple Brex organizations:

    • Foundations: building strong, resilient, and robust APIs, libraries, and tools to power Brex engineers and operations
    • Product: creating customer-facing products and features for our end-users
    • Platform: working on the systems that power Brex’s financial infrastructure, mobile/web experiences and risk/fraud systems

  • Own functionality and scalability features by taking responsibility of your project from inception to deployment, you'll tackle difficult challenges related to scale and functionality

  • Participate in the full software development lifecycle - design, development, testing, operating in production

  • Uphold our high engineering standards and bring consistency to the codebases, infrastructure, and processes you will encounter.

Requirements

  • Graduating from a BA/BS program in 2023
  • Strong knowledge of CS fundamentals
  • Strong communication, interpersonal skills, and eagerness to learn from others
  • Are excited about working in a high-paced environment with other high quality engineers
  • Familiarity with software engineering development cycles
  • Experience working with backend programming languages (i.e. Java, Kotlin, Python)
  • If Frontend, experience working with Typescript, React, and React Native
  • Experience working with SQL or NoSQL databases
  • Ability to hold yourself and the team to high standards

Bonus points

  • Experience collaborating with experts in product, design, and operations
  • Familiarity with functional programming languages
  • Strong writing skills
  • Proactive approach
  • Experience with corporate financial systems or concepts
  • Experience with cloud computing systems & services

The RPM/Spry Health team is a small, independent group within Itamar Medical. We are changing how people interact with healthcare and driving better outcomes for patients with chronic conditions such as Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA), Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and Congestive Heart Failure (CHF).

We are dedicated to building a happy and cohesive workplace culture. As much as we want to see if you are a good fit for us, it is important that you consider if Spry Health is a good fit for you. Check out our culture deck for a more comprehensive look at how we work to achieve our mission.

Learn more at https://spryhealth.com/join-spry-health/

This in-person internship will begin as soon as September 20th, and will be no fewer than three months in length. This is not a summer internship.

Position Summary:

The Data Engineering Intern will assist in creating software infrastructure, pipelines, and tools to digest large volumes of data. They will assist in building research software infrastructure for clinical studies and evaluations. The Data Engineering Intern will get exposed to all aspects of the business and have a chance to leverage the benefits of a small, cohesive, cross-functional team. The person holding the position will report to our Head of Research - US.

Primary Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Create software infrastructure, pipelines, and tools to digest large volumes of data.
  • Implement web-based interfaces and decision-making tools to interact with data on a granular level.
  • Deploy benchmarking tools for algorithms and methods.
  • Build research software infrastructure for clinical studies and evaluations.
  • Develop APIs for access to data and results.
  • Integrate Python based algorithms and methods into cloud-based infrastructure.

Qualifications:****

  • Experience designing and implementing software tools and pipelines.
  • Demonstrated experience interacting with APIs to push and pull required data for analysis.
  • Fluent in Python and Version Control (Git, svn, etc.).
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP).
  • Independent - can learn and gain new knowledge on their own.
  • Must be able to communicate effectively & maintain professional conduct at all times.
  • Organized, self-starter with the ability to handle several tasks and prioritize workload with minimal supervision.
  • Able to work longer hours or after hours to support company needs if they arise.

Experience and Education Requirements:

  • Pursuing M.S. or PhD (or Recent Graduate) in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related fields
  • Minimum 1 year of industrial or academic research experience operating in a small team working with Python based data pipelining or big data infrastructure.

Itamar is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment will receive consideration without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, citizenship status or protected veteran status.

We are dedicated to building a happy and cohesive workplace culture. As much as we want to see if you are a good fit for us, it is important that you consider if Spry Health is a good fit for you. Check out our culture deck for a more comprehensive look at how we work to achieve our mission.

Learn more at https://spryhealth.com/join-spry-health/

Position Summary

The Firmware Engineer Intern will assist in the development, testing, and support of embedded systems for real-time data collection. The Firmware Engineer Intern will get exposed to all aspects of the business and have a chance to leverage the benefits of a small, cohesive, cross-functional team. The person holding the position will report to our Head of Software and Firmware - US.

This internship will begin as soon as September 1, and will be no fewer than three months in length.

Primary Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Assist in the design and implement real-time embedded data collection systems for physiological signal processing
  • Assist in the design and implement embedded systems to interface with a central Cloud Infrastructure
  • Select, bring-up, and benchmark new IC’s/technologies that can benefit our product offerings (e.g. sensors, MPUs, memory, wireless capabilities, etc...)
  • Assist with the design and implement prototype systems for our R&D group
  • Optimize/Productize firmware for commercial deployment
  • Maintain existing firmware libraries (and tests) for our hardware platforms
  • Other job duties as assigned by management.

*Qualifications: *

  • C Code writing experience for a minimum of 3 years.
  • Demonstrated working with a new chip or MCU
  • Wrote firmware to bring up hardware, successfully brought up MCU
  • Experience with: sensors/actuators, DACs, ADCs, ASICs etc...
  • Fluent in C, Real-time OS, and Version Control (Git, svn, etc.)
  • Experience with SPI, I2C, USB
  • Ability to quickly adapt and respond to job, environmental, and industry changes.
  • Independent - can learn and gain new knowledge on their own.
  • Must be able to communicate effectively & maintain professional conduct at all times.
  • Organized, self-starter with the ability to handle several tasks and prioritize workload with minimal supervision.
  • Able to work longer hours or after hours to support company needs if they arise.

*Experience and Education Requirements: *

  • Master’s Degree (or currently enrolled) in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
  • Minimum three years’ experience operating in a small team working with embedded systems (start-up or research team)

position: Test Automation Developer - PEY Intern, Winter 2022
description:
Wonolo (Work Now Locally) is disrupting the $140BN temporary staffing industry. Founded in 2014, Wonolo's mission is to help people find consistent work. Through our two-sided tech marketplace, we connect hundreds of businesses in need of front-line workers with over 1 million underemployed workers in local markets across the United States, within minutes. Wonolo empowers the in-demand workforce by democratizing access to flexible work, opportunities to learn new skills, a living wage, and comprehensive portable benefits and perks.

Wonolo is looking for a Test Automation Developer Intern who wants to dive in headfirst and help us accelerate the growth of our platform. We are looking for a Python developer who will join the Internal Tools and Automation team to support on-going efforts to transform our testing capabilities from manual to fully automated, as well as enable our Mobile, Web, and Platform engineering teams to build faster and better products at scale.

The Internal Tools team is made up of talented Full-stack and Backend Developers, Test Automation Developers, and a Product Manager, who like to build solutions that improve the daily lives of colleagues as well as boost the performance of the marketplace. This team works cross-functionally with various technical and operations teams on automation projects, internal tooling, API and third party integrations, among other initiatives. As part of this team you will increase the productivity of other teams and drive value for the business.

This opportunity is open to students located anywhere in Canada and who are interested in 12 or 16 month co-ops, with a start time of May 2022.

What you'll do:

  • Participate in building test automation frameworks for APIs, Web Portals, and Mobile Applications using Python and Robot Framework
  • Help design, architect and execute initiatives to improve product quality
  • Assist other team members in creating, evaluating and prioritizing test cases for automation
  • Actively participate in keeping internal knowledge base up to date

Who you are:

  • You have experience working with Python
  • You enjoy automating tasks and creating test frameworks
  • You understand and care about all the constraints regarding software quality and can research and propose different ideas and approaches to improve test coverage
  • Excited by the opportunity to test and support highly scalable, world-class products
  • Flexible and willing to learn different technologies and test frameworks
  • Eager to work in an agile development environment
  • Humble, driven, creative, willing to make mistakes and learn from them, and excited to raise others up

Benefits and perks:

  • Competitive compensation; we follow the University's recommended rates and typically pay above average
  • Company laptop
  • Monthly cell phone reimbursement ($66 CAD)
  • Exciting opportunities for growth, whether it is through mentorship, by contributing to mission critical projects, or working alongside top talent in Tech and Engineering, you should expect high impact
  • We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer flexible schedules with the option to work remotely from anywhere in Canada
  • Company events and team outings (both virtual and local meetups, always outdoors)
  • Unlimited high fives!

Kepler is on a Mission to bring the internet to space. Incorporated in 2015, Kepler’s guiding star is to enable the space economy through the creation of a communication network in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) that will provide connectivity services to other space missions, be they on orbit in LEO, MEO, GEO, or beyond. With an expanding base of early customers and our first 15 satellites in orbit, Kepler is continuing to grow and expand its most important asset – the Team! Based out of our HQ in Toronto and with an office in the UK and a newly formed office in the US we are building towards a truly global company delivering a product for the whole world.

We're on the hunt for a top-tier RF/Antenna Intern.

Your focus will be on assisting RF hardware development and test, specifically hardware related to both our space-based communications payloads as well as ground-based assets. We are looking for exceptional candidates with the below experience along with any unique abilities that could be used to augment our small but strong RF team.

Responsibilites:

  • Assist more senior engineers in all activities related to RF/Antenna design, manufacture and test for spacecraft, ground terminals and test infrastructure
  • Assist in the design of new RF hardware by performing component selection, schematic capture, layout and fabrication as well as design reviews
  • Perform performance and acceptance testing for RF frontends and antennas using equipment such as VNAs, Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators and antenna range systems (far-field and near-field)
  • Write software to control test equipment or hardware under test in languages such as Python/C/VEE
  • Build infrastructure to assist in the testing of RF hardware
  • Simulate and model RF systems and structures for new designs and test setups

Requirements:

  • Currently enrolled in an Engineering, Physics or similar degree program
  • Experience in hardware design outside of class projects, particularly related to RF and/or Antennas. Experience on cubesat teams is a strong plus
  • Experience with circuit design/layout tools such as Altium/Eagle/KiCad
  • Experience with programming languages such as Python and C++, particularly as it relates to controlling hardware or modeling RF systems
  • Experience with a commercial RF designs tools such as ADS/CST/HFSS is a plus
  • Experience with basic RF concepts such as: impedance matching, smith chart, network analysis, active and passive microwave components and systems (mixers, amplifiers, transistors at RF frequencies) and their figures of merit (P1dB, Psat, IIP3, noise figure, etc.), RF filter design, antenna figures of merit
  • Some experience with RF test equipment such as VNAs, Spectrum Analyzers, Signal Generators and antenna test systems (far-field/near-field)

Snapcommerce is a high growth company that sits at the intersection of mobile commerce and fintech. Our flagship product Snaptravel allows millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging. We are currently in the scale-up phase of the company with plans to grow from ~100 employees to ~300+ employees as fast as possible while maintaining the competitive advantages and culture of being a startup

With a high-performing team of world class leaders, Snapcommerce thrives on tackling complex problems within AI, E-commerce, and Conversational Design to push the boundaries of the value we can add to our user’s lives!

At Snapcommerce, we pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we’ve created for our team to prosper and excel. Our values are rooted in making data driven-decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the company.

Please note that although this position at Snapcommerce is remote friendly, candidates must be located and authorized to work in the US/Canada as a precondition of employment. Snapcommerce does not sponsor applicants for work visas.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Engineer Intern with 6-18 months of experience to join our growing team for the Fall 2021 term.

Our Tech:
*We use a SOA architecture powered by many micro-services, including the bot platform, the NLP engine and the pricing/recommendation engines
*Data pipeline tools including Python, Flume, Kafka/Firehose, Redshift/Athena and more
*We have a distributed ETL infrastructure hosted using Docker and AWS
*TLDR: Python and Airflow. Lots of AWS. Bleeding-edge tech.

Challenges You'll Solve

  • As a Data Engineer, you are comfortable building highly reliable and scalable ETL pipelines that get large data sets (we do over 10 million searches/day) from various sources to our BI platform.
  • In this role you will have the opportunity to build scalable and highly available data pipelines using bleeding-edge tech and tools in one of Toronto's fastest-growing Data Science teams.
  • We work in small teams of 3-5 Engineers with a get-things-done attitude, so you'll have lots of autonomy to create impact while tackling complex technical challenges.

About You

  • You have at least 6-18 months of Data Engineering work experience, preferably with exposure to a dynamic, startup environment
  • You learn quickly, regardless of the languages and technologies used
  • You have experience building scalable data pipelines and powerful reporting tools
  • You thrive on solving complex problems with logical, well-reasoned solutions.

We Believe in Equal Opportunity

  • Own features, services, caches, and databases

  • Work in a agile team of 5 engineers with a get-things-done attitude, so you'll have lots of autonomy to create impact while tackling complex technical challenges

About Faire

Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future of retail is local. There are over 1M independent retailers in the U.S. and Canada doing more than twice the revenue of Walmart and Amazon combined. At Faire, we're using the power of technology and data to connect a growing community of over 150,000 brands and independent retailers around the world. Picture your favorite boutique in town — we help them discover the best products to sell in their stores. By empowering entrepreneurs with the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses can compete with big box and e-commerce giants. We’re looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

Job Description

We have several Intern positions in the following 3 fields:

  1. Personalization (Recommendations, Ranking, Search)
  2. Growth & Experimentation
  3. Marketplace Optimization and Underwriting

On the Data Science team, we’re looking for someone who’s comfortable working on interesting growth, engagement, and retention-related problems across our two-sided marketplace using both cutting edge and proven techniques. As a member of a fast-growing company and team, you will be working closely with other data scientists, engineers, and product managers to provide effective support and work on a number of problems related to helping acquire retailers and brands at scale in an efficient manner and improve retention as well as lifetime value.

Our internships are paid and 12-to-14 weeks in duration. We have flexible start dates, are open for extensions, and ultimately hope that interns can convert into full-time employees with our team.

What you will be doing:

  • Define, plan and execute cutting-edge machine learning or deep learning research applied to ranking, search, retrieval, or recommendations
  • Develop new algorithms that will be a/b tested and should achieve state-of-the-art accuracy
  • Communicate the experimental results clearly, both within the group as well as to the broader team
  • Be comfortable with pytorch, python, sklearn, numpy, pandas, SQL; and have familiarity with Statistics (Bayesian methods, experimental design, causal inference)

What it takes:

  • You are entering the final year of your MS & PhD in 2022, with a focus in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related technical field
  • Growth & Experimentation Team:
    • Experience with statistical modeling, hypothesis & A/B testing, and experimentation frameworks
  • Marketplace Risk & Optimization:
    • Experience with predictive modeling related to forecasting demand and supply to enable optimal pricing strategies to help increase Faire’s resale channel sales, or
    • Experience working on datasets related to financial products such as creditworthiness
  • Personalization Team:
    • Experience in developing machine learning solutions for ranking, search, retrieval, or recommendations
  • A track record producing academic papers that have been showcased in top journals or conferences

Why you’ll love working at Faire

  • We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is an owner of the business and taking part in the founding process.
  • We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of over 100,000 small business owners.
  • We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.
  • We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.

Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. position: Sales Operations & Strategy - Data Engineer Intern
description:
The Basics:

Tanium is looking for a curious, driven, and hardworking individual to join its Global Sales Strategy & Operations organization as a 2022 Data Engineer Summer Intern. This role will interact with various teams and levels of management, and the right candidate must have the ability to communicate with multiple levels across Sales, Finance, and other Operations teams.

This person must be an analytical and critical thinker, a problem solver, a curious deep diver, and a clear communicator. She/he must be able to roll-up their sleeves, and work directly with the models and data, while also keeping the bigger picture in mind when sharing any findings or narratives with the rest of the business. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, independent, confident speaking to a group, and naturally inquisitive. This person may also maintain strategic alignment with sales operations and sales leadership, provide value-add business insights and organizational support, and build programs and efficient processes that drive growth.

The position can be located anywhere in the continental United States.

What you’ll do:

  • Join a high-performing, geographically dispersed team to enable critical insight and operational excellence across regional sales organizations
  • Enhance and develop data models so business can drive insight out of the data
  • Maintain and build data pipeline to integrate system data into our snowflake data warehouse
  • Develop processes to ensure systems contain accurate, reporting-ready data
  • Support ad-hoc data requests in support of Sales initiatives

We’re looking for someone with:

  • Bachelor’s Degree candidate, majoring in information systems or a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Information System, Information Technology)
  • 2-3 years of college or university classes/credits
  • Proficiency in SQL, Snowflake, Python
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting to executives and large groups

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working within a high-growth, technology company
  • Experience partnering directly with leaders at the VP level or above
  • Experience with SQL, Snowflake, Power Query, Python, Sharepoint, Power App and/or equivalent

About Tanium:

Tanium offers an endpoint management and security platform built for the world’s most demanding IT environments. Many of the world’s largest and most sophisticated organizations — including nearly half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and multiple branches of the U.S. Armed Forces — rely on Tanium to make confident decisions, operate efficiently, and remain resilient against disruption. Tanium has been named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list of “Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing” for five consecutive years and ranks 4th on FORTUNE’s list of the “Best Workplaces in Technology 2020.”

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it’s imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things.

Taking care of our team members

Each of our team members has 5 days set aside as volunteer time off (VTO) to contribute to the communities they live in and give back to the causes they care about most.

Working with a mentor in our engineering team you’ll select a project from a library of prototype, internal tool, and product feature projects vetted by our mentors. Over the course of the internship, supported by your mentor, and working with our engineers you’ll implement the project and present what you’ve built to Tanium’s engineering team.

Examples of prior projects include:

  • A visualization tool for Tanium’s privileges and roles
  • Question prediction for Tanium’s natural language parser
  • A Node.js module for presenting application health

  • Work as a member of Tanium’s engineering team

Company Overview

Pareto Care is a medical device company developing a wearable biosensor platform to measure hemodynamic parameters important to the management of many clinical conditions including heart failure. Our products are reliable, affordable and designed with a core focus on user experience. Our team is driven to develop products that will change the way patients and clinicians manage health outcomes. We are dedicated to the personal and professional growth of all our team members and strive to create a positive and creative work environment. The Biomedical Engineering Intern will join our Research & Development Team. This internship will allow you the opportunity to work on multiple projects including but not limited to sensor design, sensor development, and sensor validation. You would play a crucial role in the design and development of our biosensors. You will be conducting research aimed at obtaining a comprehensive understanding of cardiac functions, hemodynamics, ECG, bioimpedance and tissue optics.

We want this internship to be a holistic and rewarding experience for you! We want to help you take the next step in your career as a biomedical engineer. We believe the best engineers don’t just bring a wealth of knowledge to the table, but a structured problem solving approach to research and development that is centered around the objective. Join us in our journey to improve patient outcomes while keeping them outside the hospital.

Responsibilities

  • Conducting extensive research on impedance cardiography and electrocardiogram technology
  • Exploring various electronic components for development and verification of sensor designs
  • Solving design and development challenges at the intersection of hemodynamics, electronics and optics
  • Communicating research findings with the R&D team

Required Skills

  • Ability to work with a cross-functional team
  • Knowledge of human physiology and hemodynamics
  • Ability to solve complex multidisciplinary problems
  • Ability to foresee challenges and come up with potential solutions
  • Ability to communicate complex scientific research in simple terms

Desired Experience

  • Pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Biomedical Engineering or similar discipline
  • Previous research experience working with Hemodynamics or Electrocardiogram or Impedance Cardiography
  • Previous experience designing and conducting experiments

KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of meta-search brands including momondo, Cheapflights, Swoodoo, checkfelix and Mundi.
